title: Feels great first thing in the morning!
content: My face often feels hot in the morning and my eyes are sometimes puffy. This feels great to roll over my face and chest when I wake up. I love holding the roller on my eyes and hearing the crackle of the ice. It stays cool for a good amount of time, I wish it stayed 'cold' longer but I still love it. Other reviews mentioned the squeakiness of the roller and I experienced that as well. In fact, so much so that I planned to return it because it was so annoying. But I decided to try something first. I put a little bit of olive oil on my finger and rubbed it in to the grooves where the roller sits and it worked! That was several weeks ago and it hasn't squeaked since!
author: Stephanie House
product: ESARORA Ice Roller for Face & Eye, Puffiness, Migraine, Pain Relief and Minor Injury, Skin Care Products

title: Needs to be "unstuck" to get going
content: I ordered this ESARORA Ice Roller because I was going to be having a procedure done at my dermatologist's office, and wanted to have an ice roller to use afterwards because it would be easier, and better, than holding an ice pack. I chose the ESARORA Ice Roller over other offerings for two reasons: (1) more ratings, and (2) it comes with a second roller insert thingy (technical term). I placed my order on July 5, and as a Prime member, I was assured delivery would be on July 7.  Pefect.  On July 9 it still had not been delivered, and I was receiving messages from Amazon that they didn't know when it would be delivered, that it may be lost, and if I still didn't have it in two more days, I could cancel the order.  Instead, I ordered an Ice Roller by SPANLA 2, that also came with a spare roller (and was more than $10 less expensive).  The SPANLA 2 Ice Roller was delivered on July 11, and later that day the ESARORA Ice Roller was delivered.  Of course. At any rate, I decided to keep both of them because who knows when we might have a need for more than one at a time... (and it's a pain in the patoot to return things). After my procedure at the dermatologist's office, I came home and used to ESARORA Ice Roller.  It worked great, but to get it going, I had to "unstick" the roller.  It froze in place.  I sort of expected that, because the Ice Roller I was given to use while still at the doctor's office did the same thing.  So, if you get one of these, be sure to make sure that the roller will actually roll/turn before you put it against whatever part of your body you're using it on. Oh, by the way, the Ice Roller the dermatologist's office had me use was a SPANLA 2!!  AND, having gotten both brands delivered on the same day, it was interesting to compare the boxes and the written instruction sheet.  They're made by the same company.
author: Just My Opinion
product: ESARORA Ice Roller for Face & Eye, Puffiness, Migraine, Pain Relief and Minor Injury, Skin Care Products

title: Great Price - Great Product!
content: Uses and Benefits I have been using the ESARORA Ice Roller for almost a month now and it has changed my daily routine for the better. It has multiple uses that I have found to be extremely helpful for my eyes, headaches, and skin. First, this has improved the puffiness under my eyes tremendously. I have found myself struggling to get an adequate amount of sleep and waking up with major bags under my eyes. But keeping this product in either the fridge or freezer and rolling it under my eyes in the morning has helped the puffiness go down. Second, this has been a miracle for sinus headaches. Living in the Midwest, the winters are brutal and so are my sinus infections. This ice roller instantly relieves the pressure and pain I feel on my face from the infection. Lastly, my skin has transformed drastically since using this product. I have always struggled with irritating texture and large pores. Since I started using this, I noticed my pores have gotten noticeably smaller which makes the days of not wearing makeup that much better! After using this product, I immediately told my close friends and family about it. My mother, my grandmother and I all struggle with sinus infections and pain so I knew that they had to buy it. They both love it as much as I do, for sinus pain and their skin! I think men and women of all ages can find great uses for this product. Durability The ice roller came in great packaging and was sealed very well. It was extremely easy to put together. All I had to do was clean the roller head first and store it in a bag in the fridge or freezer. Once it was cold, it was very east to attach the roller head to the handle. The roller handle feels very high quality and I know that it will last me a very long time. Price Ordering this ice roller on Amazon saved me so much money. I have Amazon Prime, so I was able to get this product for only $11.99! In my opinion, that price cannot be beat. Other face rollers that I have seen have ranged from $15-$30 which does not even compare to this ice roller. I truly do not know what I did without this product in my life! I highly recommend you get your hands on this product!

product: ESARORA Ice Roller for Face & Eye, Puffiness, Migraine, Pain Relief and Minor Injury, Skin Care Products

title: LIFE CHANGER!
content: I bought this for myself as a Christmas present, after seeing it on one of those ‚Äúlists of things you should buy‚Äù on Facebook. Best purchase ever. I have been an intractable migraine sufferer for 10 years(adding chronic migraine here too so those peeps might find this more easily) and I so wish I had found this years ago. With my migraine, my face gets hot, and I get sinus pressure too. My headache hard help a lot, but they miss this crucial area. This is such a help! I already do the last few minutes of my shower with cold water each night, but this is so much better! It is the perfect amount of cold, cold enough to make you feel wonderful without being too cold. It is super convenient to keep in the freezer and grab as needed. I would 100% buy again(and probably will!) and definitely recommend this to any migraine, sinus pain, or headache sufferer!

The ONLY two things seems to help. 2. wrapping a TIGHT band around my head (sometimes problematic with hair and probably not too wise to keep something wrapped tightly around your head for too long!) and 2. holding a mug filled with ice (and covered with ‚Äúpress & seal‚Äù) against my eye socket. That kept the ice cold the longest and gave me relief. When I found this I thought it would be easier than prepping those ice mugs and HOORAY‚Ä¶ this is really HANDY!  Something about the rolling pressure and being able to use it all over my face it truly did help quite a lot! Will be something I would even consider traveling with if I‚Äôm staying long enough with a freezer available since often different geographical locations have different pressure (and flying etc.) adds to the pressure changes.

title: not a gimmick

I keep it in my beauty to mini fridge that has a little freezer built in. after letting it chill for 2 days i decided to try it. I used on my face after using my toner and serum and holy amazing. the coolness soothes my irritated skin and instantly calmed down all the puffiness. I tend to sweat after showers in the summer and have severe dry itchy skin. I used after my lotion on my legs and arms and for the first time all summer had relief from the itch on my legs. I had epilated my legs and had a bad reaction as well as horrible i‚Äôm grown hairs that just made things worse. the cortisone cream was just thick and greasy and only provided relief briefly. this roller however along with some light lotion from cerave for itch relief (the red bottle ) works like a charm after ever shower. also rolled it over my husbands back of neck and head as he had almost passed out from mowing the lawn in the heat and even he was impressed.

title: Jack of all Trades
content: This roller is great.  I initially got it to help reduce eye puffiness (hellooo crying eyes).  I now use it most mornings while I am drinking my coffee to help reduce the overnight swelling and to help wake me up.  In addition, I suffer from migraines and this ice roller is a wonderful tool to use if a cold compress is something that soothes your migraines.  I will sometimes hold the ice roller over whichever eye is throbbing with pain the most.  Lastly, this year I got clocked in the head by a German Shepard, the cut was pretty bad (probably should have gotten stitches), and once it started to heal I used this ice roller on it to help with the healing process and I can barely see the mark on my forehead.  This tool is definitely a jack of all trades.  In the 8 or so months that I have been using this, I only had one issue.  The sides on the roller started to slide out and the liquid inside the roller oozed out a bit.  It was a simple fix of  popping the plastic pieces back where they needed to be and it was good to go!

title: Happy but could be a touch happier üòÅ
content: So I got this because I have rosacea and my face gets so hot and painful. It does help with pain relief! It feels good and refreshing. I am a little disappointed because based on the pictures and the beads I thought it would be squishy but it is hard plastic. There is no give at all to get nicely around eyes and nose. It was a little leaky out of the package as you can see in the picture. I gave it a quick wash which I would have anyway. I started with storing in the fridge and it felt good that way. I froze it and it was pretty cold but still refreshing and not too cold in my opinion. It stays cold for long enough. Maybe 30 min to pushing it to an hour? And I've left it out twice overnight and no additional leakage. When deciding if I should purchase I wasn't sure that it would be easy to hold and use but it's not bad at all. If you have soft slippery hands (like my dad even though he worked with his hands his whole life) and things slide out of your hands I would not get this. So overall I would do 3.5 out of 5 stars. I see some improvements that could be made but for now, my face says thank you!

title: Works great!
content: So far I have bought a total of 3 and am considering buying 1 or 2 more just as gifts. (But if I do, I'll probably just keep those too!) These are wonderful for headaches, migraines, minor aches, flushed cheeks, overheated or feverish faces, to close pores, to ease stress in the neck and shoulders, and so much more! They are exactly as pictured, come in perfect condition and roll smoothly. This is my favorite because it comes with 2 types of rollers. (Definitely get the one that has the 2 types of rollers!) The metal gets icy and warms quicker than the gel bead roller. The gel bead roller stays cold for a good while. Both feel great on the skin and roll smoothly with no squeaky sounds. We keep all of the rollers in the freezer and keep the handles safely in a drawer close by. We use them all the time, so buying more than 1 was a necessity. If you really want to chill your skin for a long time, then I suggest buying more than one and just change the rollers when they get warm. Or if there is a chance a family member may take yours, then definitely buy more than one! This really helps with our migraines and when we get overheated in the garden. Hmmm, with the hot weather coming to Florida, I probably should buy a few more. I definitely recommend this item. Oh, I bought all blue handled rollers so everyone shares equally. There's no chance of hearing "that's my handle", because they are all the same. Just a helpful tip for ya'.

title: Get This, If You're Looking to Apply Cold to Your Face/Body
content: I bought this to apply cold to my eyes which get puffy.  After putting this is the freezer, it becomes the perfect tool for applying cold to my eyes. When I place ice on my face, I can only hold it there so long before it becomes a little painful - like pins pricking me.  That doesn't happen with this roller. The other really nice thing that I've found is that it holds the cold for a looooong time.  In fact, I'm not quite sure when the metal on the roller becomes warm because I usually get bored (or tired) of holding it to my face before it ever gets cold. If you're looking for something to get rid of that puffiness, or a way to wake up in the morning, this is the thing for you.

title: Just dreamy ‚Äî and redemption when you just can't NOT touch a blemish
content: I love this thing. It has a ton of uses and is perfect in so many ways. The roller freezes, but the outside silicone keeps it from sticking to your skin. It doesn't pull on your skin at all. Super gentle. Because of the rolling motion, you are doing on-and-off cold, which is better and more pleasant than constant cold. The roller itself detaches from the handle, which is great for washing it. I usually keep the whole thing in the freezer so I can lie it on its back and have the roller not touching anything inside the freezer. Best uses I've discovered: 1) Calming my skin down after picking at it. OK, so you're not supposed to pick at your face or squeeze anything, but sometimes you just can't resist. This is magic for that ‚Äî like icing an injury, so it reduces any redness and seems to help everything get back to normal faster. It's the face equivalent of having a glass of water after night drinking ‚Äî the damage is done, but might as well try to help however I can. 2) Headaches/migraines. Feels amazing on your face and on the back of your neck. The roller gives your face a mini massage and the cool really helps. Pain meds, then a dark room lying down with this thing and you're on your way back to normal. 3) After peels/drying masks/dermarolling. Again with cooling your skin down, but it helps with recovery, especially if you left your peel/mask on a little too long. Calms redness after dermarolling and helps begin the recovery process. Basically you're fighting inflammation.

title: Nice, I really like it (update love it more a year later).
content: This is very good. I haven't used the metal ones but t his is more like plastic with something gel in it. It stays cold a long time. It's too cold. Every morning and night, I just use the ice roller on my face - you have to use it for at least 5-10 minutes for it to really work though, and I feel a lot better! Every time my sinus hurts or I have a puffy face or itchy eyes, I just use the ice roller, and it definitely helps quickly. title: Not a very good shape for the inner eye/side of nose areas
content: After using this product for a few weeks now, I've noticed that the product is easy to hold/roll - and does deliver the tension-relief and relaxation that I was hoping for around my jaw, neck, and temple areas, but it is hard to get it to contour to the inner eye/side of nose areas, so if you are someone that struggles with sinus relief and allergies related to itchy or agitated eyes seeking out this product, I would recommend just throwing a smaller, sturdy jade roller in the freezer for 30+ minutes. Otherwise, the "bag" that they give you to put the roller piece in is just a very thin, unsealable plastic sheath, not an actual cloth bag or anything, so you would do better to put it in a Ziploc or something else. Overall, I am using the product still and feeling some relief, but I will probably only continue until I find a better designed product with the same function.

title: I love this facial roller!!!

This one is very easy to use and the roller pops in and out easily so I can keep it in the freezer. I found a quick how-to video on YouTube and I was ready to go. A full facial massage takes about 5 minutes and I‚Äôm amazed at the results.  I‚Äôve tried every cream and remedy imaginable and nothing has helped my relentless undereye bags.  Within 2 days of using this (two times a day) my bags went down considerably, my skin feels smoother and my entire neck and face feels revitalized. These rollers have been used in Asian cultures for centuries and they‚Äôve been gaining more and more popularity in this country. I can see why. I‚Äôve spent so much money in my lifetime buying so many high priced eye and face creams and I‚Äôve never experienced results like this. It de-puffed my eyes considerably the first time I used it. It‚Äôs great for those mornings when you wake up with a puffy face and eyes. It‚Äôs great for when you need to get dressed quickly and your eyes are all puffy. title: Wonderful and relaxing
content: I have been drooling over one of these for a while now so I finally decided I needed to just buy it! I am so very glad that I did! It is cold but very relaxing and since you keep it moving, it does not get the chance to get too cold like an ice pack would. I love that I can remove the roller and keep it in the freezer and it is ready whenever I need it. I have fibromyalgia but also train in martial arts regularly so I never know when I might need to use this. It works well for sore muscles, a strained neck or just to melt the day's stress away. The handle is a sturdy but lightweight plastic and the roller is hard. when I first read the description I thought the gel would make the roller give a little but it is completely contained inside the roller. It also does not get super wet and drip water down your face as you are suing it. I like that a lot! Ice packs always sweat and can be very messy. I will buying more of these for gifts as they are perfect for anyone. Even my husband enjoys using it an as we get older, we could all use a little pampering.

title: Must Have Gadget for Happy Skin
content: I am a licensed esthetician and recommend that all my clients keep one of these ice rollers. They are also a huge part of the Acne Clearing Program at my studio. I also use these in various treatments I offer. Using extreme cold properly (slow but constant motion) can significantly reduce inflammation. Inflammation is at the root of so many skin care concerns, and long-term inflammatory conditions actually break down our important skin proteins (collagen, elastin) leading to skin damage and aging. For breakout prone skin, cold is one of the best and least expensive ways to lessen the severity and number of breakouts (along with a proper skin care regimen of course). My acne clients are instructed to work with icing of the skin 2x daily. My aging clients once or twice daily based on skin condition. The body also recognizes the cold and sends fresh blood to the area - leaving you with beautifully radiant skin. I love these rollers because they stay cold for a good amount of time, are easy to disinfect (which you should do after every use), and extremely affordable. This can be one of the most useful - and cheap - aspects of your skin care regimen!

title: Works for Pores, Puffiness, and Sinus Pressure Relief
content: I purchased this product because I tend to have large pores on my cheeks and chin.  I was a bit apprehensive that it would work, but gave it a shot.  I was pleasantly surprised that it did seem to minimize my cheek and chin pores.  Another bonus was that it minimized puffiness under my eyes from lack of sleep.  I have tried all of the other pore/puffiness reduction methods; cucumbers, tea bags, Benefit Puff Off, Peter Thomas Roth Pore Putty, and Tony Moly Cooling Eye stick.  This product has worked much better than any of those mentioned.  I place it in the fridge every night before bed and use it every morning before beginning my makeup routine. This product is also very helpful for sinus headaches. With the fall approaching my allergies have been going crazy.  I pulled this tool out of the fridge and used it to massage my head and sinus areas.  It did work in minimizing my headache and soothed my inflamed sinus areas. I highly recommend this product for anyone looking to minimize pores, reduce puffy under eye areas, and / or soothe sinus headache and pressure.

I use this for my face so while rolling you just need to be sure to rotate the piece a full 360 degrees. Your face is small, so going back and forth on your cheeks or forehead only exposes a small section of the roller causing it to warm faster. Anyway, I highly recommend. My only wish is that the whole thing was smaller- like I said since I only use this for my face it would be nice to be able to get around my nose and eyes more easily with a smaller roller piece. If you are using this for sore muscles elsewhere it will be perfect.

title: BEWARE: Leaked Gel that irritated and stuck to my skin
content: When it arrived, it wasn't packaged in anything but the box. It didn't come in a plastic bag or protective lining inside the box. The "clear" or gel roll accessory was attached to the handle and had leaked all over the inside of the box. when I pulled it out it stuck to my hands. I didn't think much of it at first as I was just trying to figure out where it was leaking from and trying to clean up until my hands started burning. I immediately began scrubbing my hands with soap and water for over a minute. I did this about 3 times because when I dried my hands the gel was still dried onto my hands like super glue and not coming off. I repeated washing it again with soap and very hot water. My hands still sting as of right now, but I am hopeful it will go away. Clearly the gel inside the roller is toxic. I froze the metal roll accessory piece and that seems to work best instead. Please beware of leaking though....

title: Not ideal for sensitive skin
content: Easy to use - freezes quickly and stays cold long. If you're using for TMJ or pain relief, it's likely a good buy. However, within 30 minutes of using this, I had a rash breakout all around my eyes and forehead and it stuck around for about 2 weeks. In reading other comments, it seems the freezing gel may cause a reaction for some. If you're looking for ~*stunning bright red eye bags*~ and a casually peeling face, go for it. But I'd recommend a more gentle product if you've had any skin sensitivity or irritation in the past.
